page.title: 02Housing in and around Saline
page.content: The older housing in Saline borders the main streets through Saline, one lying in an east-west direction and the other lying in a north-south direction. Further housing has spread the village and changed it from what was once a linear village into a compact village. The housing estates built since around 1960 are both privately owned and local government owned. The privately owned sector outnumbers the local government sector. The housing estates are attractive, none of them being large, and the planning has included are variety of styles and interesting layout. The village of Steelend was built for and owned by the NCB until 1983/84 when the houses were put up for sale and bought by private enterprise,who are modernising and reselling them.
